TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OutputCacheParameters extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the output cache initialization settings parsed from an [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) page directive by ASP.NET. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters> class is not used by ASP.NET page or control developers. It provides a data structure used to store cache settings parsed from an [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) page directive by ASP.NET page and control parsers such as <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParser> and <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControlParser>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters> object is used with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.InitOutputCache%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to initialize the output cache for a page and its contents at run time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets an name that is associated with the settings of the output cache entry.
Docs.value: An name that is associated with the settings of the output cache entry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The profile identifies a set of cache settings in the `<outputCacheSettings>` configuration that is used as the base settings for the output cache entry.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that a cache entry is to remain in the output cache.
Docs.value: The amount of time, in seconds, that a cache entry is to remain in the output cache. The default is 0, which indicates an infinite duration.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether output caching is enabled for the current content.
Docs.value: if output caching is enabled for the current content; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the location of the cache entry.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the HTTP directive is set.
Docs.value: if the directive is set on ; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a set of database and table name pairs that the cache entry depends on.
Docs.value: A string that identifies a set of database and table name pairs that the cache entry depends on. The cache entry is expired when the table's data is updated or changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.SqlDependency%2A> string identifies databases and tables according to the name of a SQL Server cache dependency in your configuration (typically added using the `<sqlcachedependency>` configuration elements). If you use SQL Server 2005, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.SqlDependency%2A> property to "CommandNotification", which instructs ASP.NET to create row-level dependencies for all SQL commands issued within the context of the current ASP.NET page.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of character sets (content encodings) used to vary the cache entry.
Docs.value: A list of character sets by which to vary the content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When this property is set to multiple character sets, the output cache contains a different version of the requested document for each specified set.
<xref:System.Web.UI.OutputCacheParameters.VaryByContentEncoding%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited set of control identifiers contained within the current page or user control used to vary the current cache entry.
Docs.value: A semicolon-separated list of strings used to vary an entry's output cache. The property is set to fully qualified control identifiers, where the identifier is a concatenation of control IDs starting from the top-level parent control and delimited with a dollar sign ($) character.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of custom strings that the output cache uses to vary the cache entry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you specify "browser" for this property, the cache entry will be varied by browser type and major version number. If a custom string is entered, you must override the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication.GetVaryByCustomString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in your application's Global.asax file.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of header names used to vary the cache entry. The header names identify HTTP headers associated with the request.
Docs.value: A list of headers by which to vary the content.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this property is set to multiple headers, the output cache contains a different version of the requested document for each specified header.

Docs.summary: Gets a semicolon-delimited list of query string or form POST parameters that the output cache uses to vary the cache entry.
Docs.value: The list of query string or form POST parameters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this property is set to multiple parameters, the output cache contains a different version of the requested document for each specified parameter. Possible values include "none", "*", and any valid query string or POST parameter name.
